title: Rocket Lab confirms plan to catch booster with helicopter later this month
summary: Rocket Lab plans the first attempt to catch one of its returning small satellite boosters by helicopter after a launch later this month, nearly three years after the company announced its mid-air recovery and reuse concept.

title: Moog opens spacecraft-integration facility
summary: Moog Inc. is quadrupling the size of its Colorado space vehicle production facility as the New York-based company long known as a spacecraft component supplier expands its role as a space vehicle integrator.

title: NASA Awards Contracts for Aerospace Testing and Facilities Operations
summary: NASA has awarded a contract to Jacobs Technology Inc. of Tullahoma, Tennessee, to provide the agency’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, California with support services for ground-based aerospace test facilities at the center.

title: SpaceX to launch NASA’s SWOT water topography satellite on reused Falcon 9
summary: NASA has modified a contract with SpaceX to allow the company to launch the international Surface Water and Ocean Topography (SWOT) mission...

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-3 Astronauts to Discuss Mission, Splashdown
summary: As they prepare to return to Earth later this month, NASA’s SpaceX Crew-3 astronauts will answer media questions about their time aboard the International Space Station during an in-orbit news conference at 1:20 p.m. EDT Friday, April 15.

title: Download your ‘News from the 37th Space Symposium’ special digital edition
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team produced four show dailies, a nightly email newsletter and all-day web coverage during the 37th Space Symposium in Colorado Springs the week of April 4.

title: China launches three space missions, debuts new rocket configuration
summary: China launched three more space missions in recent weeks, debuting the country’s first rocket to be fitted with strap-on solid-fueled boosters and deploying satellites to image planet Earth and calibrate orbit prediction models, according to Chinese state media.

title: Space National Guard put on indefinite hold
summary: Instead of having a dedicated reserve force, the U.S. Space Force would have a regular active-duty force with full-time and part-time members, according to a proposal the Department of the Air Force submitted to Congress April 1.

title: Company that aims to race SpaceX to Mars plays with fire
summary: "We knew better as untrained college students."

title: South Korea hires SpaceX to launch five spy satellites by 2025
summary: South Korea has signed a contract with SpaceX to launch five spy satellites by 2025, with the first launch on a Falcon 9 rocket by the end of 2023.
